result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Andrew P Steele was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reporter: Heather Kieta, Conditional Release Hearing (excerpt only) 1-5-17
for Placement on Conditional Release

Attorney Jessa K. Nicholson and Attorney Nicholas Gansner in court on behalf of defendant.  Defendant waives personal appearance. Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Wiza and Detective Folkers with Fitchburg Police Department also appear with the State. Attorney Jessa K. Nicholson and Attorney Nicholas Gansner in court for Defendant Andrew P Steele. Prosecuting Atty Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for State of Wisconsin. Hearing regarding conditional release plan from Kimberly Fisher, Dane County Conditional Release Coordinator.  Parties do not find any factual errors in plan filed with the court. ADA Raymond and Atty Nicholson do not object to the court accepting conditional release plan. Ct. receives plan and per statute will remain confidential. Ct. receives updated report/letter from Dr. Knudson.  Brad Putnam speaks on behalf of the victims and proposed plan for defendant.  Mr. Putnam makes request to court for restrictions on communication with defn's children. ADA Raymond requests that conditions of contact are monitored.  Atty Nicholson joins in request for #6 of plan to be adopted. Ct adopts conditional release plan and orders placement is conditional release, subject to the plan approved by the court, which is attafched to this order. The defendant shall report immediately to the office of the Department of Corrections, Division of Community Corrections, located in the city Madison, WI.

Status conference on July 15, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Attorney Nicholas Ganser in court on behalf of defendant.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nicholas Ganser in court for Defendant Andrew P Steele. Prosecuting Atty Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for State of Wisconsin. Hearing regarding status of conditional release plan.  Ms. Dodsworth who is working on conditional release plan indicated that at this time there is no plan that can be submitted to the court as they are having difficulty finding placement for defendant. Discussion with parties why placement can't be found. Ct instructs Ms. Dodsworth and DHS to continue to try and find placement for defendant.  Atty Gansner objects to no conditional release plan being submitted in a timely manner but offers no argument for proposed relief.  ADA Raymond brings up letter ct sent to parties in May regarding contact with children, assets of defendant, and guardians of children requesting to have access to conditional release plan.  Ct. indicates assets will be discussed at a later date when/if a conditional release plan is proposed.  Ct repeats what was in letter that if defn wants contact with children he needs to work with guardians. Atty Gansner indicates defn. does want contact with children and would not object to an approved conditional release plan. ADA Raymond would object to guardian of children not being able to voice any input in the conditional release plan. Ct. will set another status conference in 30 or so days.
per Judge, defendant does not need to appear for 6-10-2016 hearing.  Defendant also does not want to appear. No objection from the State or Defense.

Reporter: Heather Kieta
Day 7 - Defendant's rebuttal evidence - testimony and exhibits; Defendant rested; jurors removed from courtroom; Court and counsel agreed that first question on the verdict form should be answered by the Court; counsel stipulated that alternate jurors should be kept sequestered for a period of time until it was determined that jurors chosen to deliberate could continue; jury instruction conference on the record; jurors returned to the courtroom; Court gave final jury instructions; closing argument by Atty Gansner for the Defendant; closing argument by Atty Raymond for the Plaintiff; rebuttal argument by Atty Nicholson for the Defendant; Jurors 1 and 9 chosen as alternate jurors and removed from the courtroom; Court continued giving final jury instructions; bailiff sworn by clerk; jury removed for deliberations; counsel had no objections to the reading of the final jury instructions; alternate jurors were returned to the courtroom and advised they would remain sequestered until it was agreed upon by the Court and counsel that they could be excused; bailiff guarding alternate jurors was sworn by clerk; Court and counsel agreed upon exhibits to be given to the jury; court recessed; court reconvened with jury questions; counsel agreed on answers to be given to the jury which was submitted to the jury in writing by the Court; court recessed; court reconvened with jury questions; counsel agreed on answers to be given to the jury which was submitted to the jury in writing by the Court; court recessed; court reconvened and counsel was advised the Court was proposing to excuse at least one alternate juror; counsel objected; Court advised it would keep alternate jurors until the end of deliberations; Court recessed; Court reconvened with jury panel present; presiding juror advised they had reached a verdict; the Court read the verdict into the record; Question 1 - Yes; Question 2 - Yes; Court polled jurors; Court gave closing jury instructions and excused jurors; Atty Nicholson moved for judgment on the verdict; Atty Barnett moved for judgment not withstanding the verdict; Court denied Atty Barnett's motion and entered judgment on the jury verdict; Court ordered Defendant committed to the Department of Health Services and ordered a predisposition investigation

Reporter: Heather Kieta
Defendant entered pleas of guilty to Counts 1 and 2 as charged in the information; Defendant still maintained his plea of not guilty by mental disease or defect; Court accepted plea and found and adjudged Defendant guilty as to Phase I; Defendant withdrew his affirmative defense of involuntary intoxication; counsel put stipulations on the record as to evidence obtained or observed while the Defendant was hospitalized; counsel for both the State and the Defendant withdrew Daubert challenges to certain witnesses; counsel stipulated that their experts could remain in the courtroom while experts from the other side were giving testimony; Court denied Defendant's motion that his father be excluded from the order sequestering witnesses; Court ordered any updated witness lists be filed by 04-09-2015; Atty Nicholson had no objection to remainder of State's motions in limine; Court granted State's motion to to disclose names of potential jurors prior to trial but that he would not make it an order and counsel was to contact the jury clerk with their request;  Atty Nicholson stipulated as to what would be admissible and relevant if the State were to use the video recordings of the Defendant's children preserving her right to object; Court and counsel discussed trial procedures; Court took brief recess and reconvened; Court and counsel discussed voir dire and individual voir dire of potential jurors; Atty Barnett advised the Court of the contact the Defendant had been having with his children without a guardian or therapist present; Court ordered Atty Nicholson to provide a statement from the childrens' therapist as to their position on the effect of the contact; Court adjourned

Information was filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of not guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued

Reporter: Heather Kieta
on motions to modify bail filed by both Defendant and the State; argument by Atty Nicholson; Court advised it would not modify Defendant's bond to allow contact with the children without information from a child psychologist as to what would be in the best interest of the children; argument by Atty Barnett; rebuttal argument by Atty Nicholson; Court found cash bond was necessary and denied the Defendant's motion; Court granted the State's motion and increased cash bond to $2,000,000 with all other conditions remaining the same

AMENDED CASH BOND
$2,000,000 per case
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any member of the Putnam family or their extended family.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with his 2 children. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any member of law enforcement whose name appears in the criminal complaint.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any known members of the Dane County Tactical Response Team.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon or firearm.
- Defendant is to surrender any firearm in his custody and control, which must be accomplished on or before Thursday, September 4, 2014.
- Defendant is not to be in the 3000 block of Yarmouth Greenway Dr, Fitchburg WI.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
- If defendant posts the cash bail, he is to be held until a hearing can be held by a Dane County Circuit Court Judge to address bail.

Reporter: Melanie Nelson
State makes motion for oral amendment to criminal complaint page 4, lines 5 and 6 regarding directionality of projectile.  Motion granted.  State requests Det Folkers be allowed to remain at prosecution table.  State requests court find cts 1 and 2 are transactionally related.  No objections by defense. Ct grants both motions.  Witness MW called, duly sworn and testifies.  No further witnesses.  Defn has no witnesses.  State moves for bind over, waives argument.  Defn objects, waives argument.  Ct finds probable cause and orders defn bound over.  Defn requests substitution of judge.  Arraignment to be held by trial court.  Defn requests to be heard on bail.  State objects and requests defn put motion in writing.  Ct orders defn put motion in writing and issue be heard by trial court.

Defendant appeared by video conference with Attorney Jessa K. Nicholson.  Paul L. Barnett and Andrea Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. & Fitchburg Detective Don Bates. Court finds the equipment being used for this hearing meets the standard required for thishearing. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts. ADA Barnett and Atty Nicholson had a previous agreement to waive the local rule, which states the initial appearance is required to take place within 72 hours of the defendant being taken into custody.
